title: Print vs. E-Book Utilization Strategies: Implementation in Elementary Social Studies Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of elementary social studies curriculum and experience with digital device utilization
context.additional_context: Process supporting practicing elementary teachers in comparing/analyzing printed vs. digital textbooks in real classrooms to develop effective teaching strategies. Practical application possible in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain criteria for selecting media aligned with educational objectives by comparing the physical/functional characteristics of print and digital books.
Learners can propose three or more practical strategies to address common issues (e.g., reduced concentration, inconvenient note-taking) when using e-books in smartphone environments.
Learners can design a blended activity (e.g., print book reading + e-book annotation features) for elementary social studies classes and submit it as a project deliverable.

resources: Collaborative tools using Google Docs/Note apps
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
